name: MEXT Japanese Government Scholarship
provider: Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology
overview: The MEXT scholarship covers tuition fees, provides a monthly stipend, and includes travel allowances for outstanding international students pursuing undergraduate or graduate studies in Japan. It is one of the most prestigious scholarships for studying in Japan.
eligibility: Meet Japanese language or English proficiency requirements
Under 35 years old for graduate programs, under 25 for undergraduate

name: JASSO Honors Scholarship
overview: JASSO provides monthly financial support to privately-financed international students with excellent academic performance. The scholarship aims to reduce financial burden and encourage academic achievement.
eligibility: International students enrolled in Japanese universities
GPA of 2.8 or higher in previous academic year

name: University of Tokyo International Student Support Fund
overview: This fund provides financial assistance to international graduate students at the University of Tokyo facing temporary financial difficulties or conducting research requiring additional funding.
eligibility: Enrolled at University of Tokyo as graduate student
Not receiving full funding from other sources

name: Lester B. Pearson International Scholarship
amount: Full tuition, books, incidental fees, and residence for 4 years
overview: This prestigious scholarship recognizes exceptional international students who demonstrate creativity, leadership, and academic excellence. It covers all educational expenses for the duration of the undergraduate degree.
eligibility: Currently in final year of secondary school
Recognized as leaders within their school and community

name: International Major Entrance Scholarship (IMES)
overview: UBC's IMES recognizes outstanding academic achievement and provides significant financial support to exceptional international students entering undergraduate programs at UBC Vancouver.
eligibility: International students requiring a study permit
Entering first year of undergraduate studies
No separate application required - automatic consideration

name: Vanier Canada Graduate Scholarships
overview: The Vanier CGS program attracts and retains world-class doctoral students by supporting those who demonstrate leadership skills and a high standard of scholarly achievement in graduate studies.
eligibility: Nominated by Canadian institution with Vanier quota
Enrolled in or applying to doctoral program
Canadian citizens, permanent residents, or international students
Demonstrated academic excellence and research potential
Leadership experience in academic or other settings

name: Australia Awards Scholarship
amount: Full tuition, living allowance ($38,000/year), travel, and health cover
overview: Australia Awards are prestigious international scholarships offering full financial support for students from developing countries to undertake undergraduate or postgraduate study at participating Australian universities. The program aims to contribute to development needs of partner countries.
eligibility: Citizens of eligible developing countries in Asia-Pacific, Africa, and Middle East
Minimum 2 years work experience for postgraduate programs
Meet academic requirements of chosen institution
Commit to returning to home country for at least 2 years after study

name: Melbourne International Undergraduate Scholarship
overview: This scholarship recognizes academically outstanding international students commencing undergraduate study at Melbourne. Awards range from partial fee remission to full tuition coverage based on academic merit.
eligibility: International students (not Australian or New Zealand citizens)
No separate application required - automatic consideration

name: Vice-Chancellor's International Scholarships Scheme
overview: This merit-based scholarship supports high-achieving international students undertaking undergraduate degrees at Sydney. Recipients receive significant tuition reduction and recognition as university scholars.

name: Chevening Scholarships
provider: UK Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office
overview: Chevening Scholarships are the UK government's global scholarship program, enabling outstanding emerging leaders from around the world to pursue one-year master's degrees in the UK. The scholarship covers tuition fees, living expenses, and travel costs.
eligibility: Bachelor's degree that enables UK postgraduate entry
Return to home country for minimum 2 years after study

name: Commonwealth Scholarship
overview: Commonwealth Scholarships support students from low and middle-income Commonwealth countries to study postgraduate courses in the UK. The program aims to support future leaders and contribute to development needs of their home countries.
eligibility: Hold a first degree of at least upper second-class honours standard
Unable to afford to study in the UK without scholarship
Committed to returning to home country
Demonstrate development impact in home country

name: Rhodes Scholarship
overview: The Rhodes Scholarship is the oldest and most celebrated international scholarship program, enabling exceptional students from around the world to study at the University of Oxford. It provides full funding for postgraduate study with a stipend for living expenses.
eligibility: Aged 18-27 on October 1 of application year
Completed undergraduate degree with high academic achievement
Demonstrated leadership, commitment to service, character
Energy to use talents to full advantage

name: Fulbright Foreign Student Program
overview: The Fulbright Program provides funding for international students to pursue master's or doctoral degrees in the United States. It covers tuition, living expenses, health insurance, and airfare, promoting cultural exchange and mutual understanding.
eligibility: Strong academic record and leadership potential
Commitment to return to home country after study

name: Hubert H. Humphrey Fellowship Program
overview: The Humphrey Fellowship brings accomplished professionals from designated countries to the United States for ten months of non-degree graduate study and professional development. It focuses on public leadership development and exchange.
eligibility: Demonstrated leadership and commitment to public service

name: Stanford Knight-Hennessy Scholars
overview: Knight-Hennessy Scholars is Stanford's flagship graduate-level scholarship program designed to develop future global leaders. It provides full funding for up to three years of graduate study at any Stanford graduate program.
eligibility: Applying to or enrolled in any Stanford graduate degree program
